intro: Psychotria subremota, commonly known as the remote psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. It is often found in shaded, humid environments such as rainforests. Psychotria subremota is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
